availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John C. Walker (Green County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Elizabeth Walker. Married to Hester Elmore Walker in Green County, Kentucky, in September 1850. Father of Peter Walker, Martha Walker, Emily C. Walker, Louisa A. Walker, and Mary J. Walker. Farmer in Green County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Green County in 1860. Employed James Barnett as a hired hand in Green County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 2, p. 140B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, p. 658.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, Lower Bush Creek Precinct, p. 489B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994036, Green County Births.
Kentucky, County Marriages, 1797-1954, Genealogical Society of Salt Lake City, Salt Lake City, UT, Green County Marriages, Film 000594645.
